channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Terrorist propaganda publicly displayed where your advertisers pay to promote their company’s., 27th June
item.description:
Promoting terrorism. Literal Hamas propaganda on your bus stop… REPEATEDLY. I’ve seen similar racist/antisemetic messaging displayed on this exact same bus stop numerous times. This has to be addressed properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 172, New Kent Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (offensive)

item.title: Car parked for 1 month, 27th June
item.description:
Hi, this car has been parked in this position for 1 month now. Its not one we or the neighbours recognise and it hasn't moved which is unusual. It doesn't look damaged or stolen though so perhaps whoever left it has gone on holiday. Could you check with the registered owner in case they're not aware, thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadoak Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent: Junction needs redesign, 27th June
item.description:
I’m writing to raise concerns about the junction at Riversdale Road & Green lanes- which is poorly designed and poses a significant risk to both vehicles and pedestrians. Due to the bend in the road, cars and vans frequently misjudge the turn, leading to repeated damage—evidenced by the broken bollards (see attached photo). I request a review of video footage be carried out to assess this. Furthermore, this area sees heavy pedestrian use, yet crossing is dangerous. The current design fails to prioritise safety and accessibility for those on foot. I strongly urge a redesign of this junction. Ideally, access should be limited to residents only, with additional landscaping and traffic-calming features to enhance safety and improve the environment. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riversdale Road, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish Collection Time table, 27th June
item.description:

item.title: Vandalised fencing, 27th June
item.description:
Fencing demolished to allow a horse onto the area but was left untethered. Possible that it could escape onto Thames Road into traffic. We have removed the smashed fence as it had multiple nails poking through in all directions and roped off the access to try to deter a repeat
